title: [FR] Basic Authentication for Scoring Server (flask)

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

The scoring server (started with mlflow serve) does not offer authentication. In most use-cases people want to protect their model endpoints.
Since the scoring server is implemented with flask, the flask-httpauth package could provide this functionality with very little overhead (https://flask-httpauth.readthedocs.io/en/latest/).

## Motivation
Everyone who wants to protect an endpoint is in the need to put something like a reverse-proxy in front of the server.
An optional basic-auth could improve this.

## Details
Implementation should be straight forward.
Optional activation of this feature could be handle via a cli option or an environment variable that is set.
